title: NOS Instructional Design for Scientific Literacy: Project-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific terminology and simple experimental experience
context.additional_context: A social studies-integrated program for pre-service teachers conducted at vocational training institutions, utilizing a collaborative and self-directed learning environment with personal devices (BYOD).

learning_goals: Students can explain the interaction between scientific methodologies and social contexts through three case analyses.

Through a 2-week project, learners apply ≥3 of the NOS 5 elements (falsifiability, creativity, tentativeness, observation/inference, social context) to real-world phenomena (e.g., workplace problem cases). They write analytical reports and achieve ≥B (70–80%) in ≥4 of 5 rubric items
Participants can document and present the process of scientific knowledge construction via reflective journaling based on team research outcomes.

resources: Digital Resources on the History of Science

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
